intro: Icacorea chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly found in Costa Rica and Panama. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as forest edges and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched.
